  3. Sgurr na Banachdich

Sgurr na Banachdich

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgurr na Banachdich is one of the easiest Munros in the Skye Cuillin, if climbed via Coir nan Eich. Nonetheless it has a fine pointed summit and magnificent views, lying at the meeting point of three great scramblers' ridges.

 You have not climbed Sgurr na Banachdich.

Region: Isle of Skye

Altitude: 965 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 4.05/5
Rating: 4.0/5 (63 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Sgurr na Banachdich via Coire nan Eich

Other routes and challenges

The complete round of Coire Ghreadaidh is described as an optional extension to the Sgurr a' Mhadaidh and Sgurr a' Ghreadaidh route.

Another option is the Sgurr nan Gobhar ridge - very unpleasant to reach, but then with good straightforward scrambling along the crest. It is also possible to ascend from the Bealach Coire na Banachdich, with very airy, challenging scrambling to negotiate or avoid three tops.
